value: Investor Member can remove the Manager for (i) cause, (ii) the filing of a bankruptcy proceeding by Manager, (iii) imposing liability on the investor member other than capital contribution payment (iv) causing the termination of the Company for federal income tax purposes or (v) causing the Company for federal tax purposes to be treated as an association taxable as a corporation.
legal_term: 8.5: The Investor Member shall have the right to remove the Manager for (i) Cause, (ii) the filing of a bankruptcy proceeding by the Manager or a Bankruptcy filing against the Manager that is not dismissed within 90 days, or (iii) action or inaction by the Manager or any Manager Affiliate that (A) imposes liability on the Investor Member other than for payment of its Capital Contributions pursuant to this Agreement, (B) causes the termination of the Company for federal income tax purposes unless expressly authorized herein, or (C) causes the Company for federal tax purposes to be treated as an association taxable as a corporation.

value:
- Acquisition of any PV System.
- Sale, lease or disposition of any Company or Project Company's assets other than FMV less than $ 25,000.
- Merger or consolidation.
- Pledging or granting any security interest.
- Entering into expense or expense sharing agreement.
- Guaranteeing or incurring in the name or on behalf of the Company or the Project Companies obligations to pay money.
- Settling any claim, litigation or arbitration with an amount in controversy that equals or exceeds $25,000.
- Incurrence of any debt on behalf of the Company or a Project Company in excess of $25,000.
- Amendment or cancellation of the Articles of Organization.
- Admission of any additional member .
- Making any capital expenditures in excess of $25,000.
- Changing the tax classification of the Company or Project Companies.
- Amending, canceling, suspending, renewing or terminating any Transaction Document.
- Changing the Company’s or Project Companies’ tax elections, methods of accounting or accounting policies and procedures.
- Confessing a judgment against the Company.
- Causing the Company or the Project Companies to enter into any contract or agreement with the Manager, or any Affiliate.
- Admitting any other entity as a manager or managing member.
- Causing the Company to file suit against any party.
- Changing the Company’s purpose.
- Causing or permitting the Company or the Project Companies to lend any funds to any Person.
- Performing any act in contravention of this Agreement or Applicable Law.
- Causing the Company to make any investments other than in the Project Companies.
- Taking or causing the Company or the Project Companies to take any action that will result in a material recapture or reduction in ITC.
- Causing the Company or the Project Companies to pay any compensation, profits distributions or allocations to the Manager in addition to the amounts permitted.
- Taking or filing any action or instituting any proceedings in Bankruptcy on behalf of the Company or Project Companies.
- Dissolving or winding up of the Company or Project Companies.
legal_term: 1.1: (a) Acquisition of any PV System, other than pursuant to the MIPA;(b) Sale, lease or disposition of any Company or Project Company assets, other than the transfer of an asset with a fair market value less than $25,000. in the ordinary course of business; (c) Any merger or consolidation or other business combination of or involving the Company or Project Companies; (d) Pledging or granting any security interest in, or other encumbrance of, all or any part of the property of the Company or the Project Companies, including any extension, conversion, amendment, modification, or refinancing of the Loans; (e) Entering into expense or expense sharing agreement with the Manager or any Affiliate of the Manager on terms that are generally less advantageous to the Company than would be the case if such transaction had been effected with a non-affiliate, except as provided in this Agreement; (f) Guaranteeing or incurring in the name or on behalf of the Company or the Project Companies obligations to pay money or perform any contract or other obligation of any Person other than the Company or the Project Companies, other than in connection with the Loans; (g) Settling any claim, litigation or arbitration with an amount in controversy that equals or exceeds $25,000. or which includes consent to or award of an injunction, specific performance or other equitable relief; (h) Incurrence of any debt on behalf of the Company or a Project Company for borrowed money in excess of $25,000. at any time outstanding in the aggregate; (i) Any amendment or cancellation of the Articles of Organization of the Company or a Articles of Organization, operating agreement or other organizational document of any Project Company; (j) The admission of any additional member in the Company or Project Companies, other than pursuant to the terms of this Agreement; (k) Making any capital expenditures, other than (i) as contemplated by the Transaction Documents, (ii) expenditures required by law, or (iii) capital expenditures not in excess of $25,000; (l) Changing the tax classification of the Company or Project Companies; (m) Amending, canceling, suspending, renewing (unless such renewal is on terms and conditions no less favorable to the Company), or terminating any Transaction Document, other than in accordance with its terms; (n) Changing the Company’s or Project Companies’ tax elections, methods of accounting or accounting policies and procedures as in effect on the date hereof; (o) Confessing a judgment against the Company; (p) Causing the Company or the Project Companies to enter into any contract or agreement with the Manager, or any Affiliate, except as expressly permitted under this Agreement; (q) Admitting any other entity as a manager or managing member or transfer or delegate general authority as managing member (except as provided in this Agreement); (r) Causing the Company to file suit against any party; (s) Changing the Company’s purpose; (t) Causing or permitting the Company or the Project Companies to lend any funds to any Person; (u) Performing any act in contravention of this Agreement or Applicable Law, or inconsistent with the Company’s purposes, or outside the scope of its authority on behalf of or in the name of the Company; (v) Causing the Company to make any investments other than in the Project Companies and temporary investments of funds pursuant to the terms of this Agreement; (w) Taking or causing the Company or the Project Companies to take any action that will result in a material recapture or reduction in ITC or other tax benefits; (x) Causing the Company or the Project Companies to pay any compensation, profits, distributions or allocations to the Manager in addition to the amounts permitted by this Agreement; (y) Taking or filing any action or instituting any proceedings in Bankruptcy on behalf of the Company or Project Companies; or (z) Dissolving or winding up of the Company or Project Companies.
poison_pill: No poison rules violations are present because the poison rules do not apply to the situation described in the text.
